artist: Artist: David Rathman; Publisher: Highpoint Editions, Minneapolis
creditline: Gift of the Print and Drawing Curatorial Council
description: cowboy on a horse at L; hanged figure with tree at R
inscription: Signature, Title, Date, Edition and Chop
medium: Etching and aquatint in dark brown ink
signed: bottom center, in pencil: [David Rathman 2002]; top edge, inside the plate, in brown: [That\'s as fair as I know how to make it.]
text: David Rathman found inspiration for his cowboy images by watching old low-budget Westerns, the once ubiquitous fare of Hollywood (and Italian) moviemaking. There's an irony in using these often clichéd melodramas as a source for his subjects, but Rathman finds that their cloying familiarity gives rise to a certain whimsy, even humor, when combined with a pertinent phrase of dialogue inserted into the scene. This despite the rather serious theme: death by murder.
title: That's as fair as I know how to make it
